text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
AD-DUSTOUR
- Crown Prince Hassan says the "causes of extremism and its eradication have to be dealt with", says the international community has to speed up easing the suffering of the Iraqi people.
- Information Minister says democracy preserves the right of individuals.
- King Hussein visits Army headquarters.
- Plans to privatise the Aqaba Railway Corporation.
AL-RAI
- Official source says Jordanian official to visit Kuwait in the coming few days to agree to resume diplomatic ties.
- Bahraini Emir praises Jordan and ties between the two countries.
- Prime Minister Kabariti discusses with Emirates ambassador joint coordination in political and educational matters.
- Israeli president arrives in Amman on Wednesday.
- Seizure of $1.5 million worth of drugs.
- Russian Foreign Minister Yevgeny Primakov to arrive in Amman on Friday to discuss bilateral ties and peace developments.
AL-ASWAQ
- Public liberties committee says it sent to council of ministers a list of 160 detained Jordanians to ask for a special royal amnesty.
- Jordan prepares social safety net projects for World Bank financing.
- Central bank rules have positive impact in activating local funds to activate the market.
JORDAN TIMES
- King phones Bahraini and Qatari rulers.
- Experts agree to amend the electoral law, but differ on specifics.
